# 𒀏 𒀊⋅𒄩 AB⋅ḪA <> 𒀖 <> elam

𒀏 NINA 𒀖 𒉏 NIM

𒀏 NINIVE 𒀏 ≈ 𒉒·𒄩 ≈ NINDA…

𒀏𒆠 Nineveh •Ninab.ecḫi

𒀏 NANŠE NINA Ninua “Nineveh”

𒀏 | NINA 𒈾 NANŠE 魚 na (Old Japanese) 𓆛 ܢܘܢܐ nūnā (fish)
𒀏 | Ninâ (𒀏) is a (𒄩 KUD cod) fish within an abode (cf. Aramaic nuna, "fish").
𒀏 | Nineveh ננוה 𒌷𒉌𒉡𒀀 /Ninuwā/ = 𒀏 𐎐𐎐𐎆 𐎚𐎐 "Ninive" town
𒀏 | AB×ḪA 𒀊𒄩 AĜARINX Aqua.Rhem (fish)
𒀏 | 𒌷𒉌𒉡𒀀 SIRARA < SA/KUR (city)

𒀏 Ninive 𒌷𒉌𒉡𒀀 Ninâ (𒀏) is a fish within a house (cf. Aramaic nuna, "fish"). 𐎐𐎐𐎆 𐎚𐎐 "Ninive" town 𒀭𒀏 NANŠE was a goddess, the daughter of Enki and Ninhursag 𒀭𒀏 NANŠE goddess of fishing, fertility, justice, prophecy 𒂍𒀭𒀏 E-Nanshe temple of Ur-Nanshe Sumerian: 𒌨𒀭𒀏 UR-NANŠE 𒌨𒀭𒀏 Ur-Nanshe first king of the First Dynasty of Lagash (approx. 2500 BCE) in the Sumerian Early Dynastic 𒌓𒈣𒀏𒆠𒋳 Also "Sirara" temple complex in Lagash

𒉏 NEM/NIM 𓆢 namak 𓈖 𓂝 𓂋 𓆛 नैना nainā 𒉡𒉡 nunu ܢܘܢܐ nūnā 𒀀𒈾𒈾 魚 鱼 na 𒀏 NINA NANŠE

tenu; 𒀏 ~ x HA; 𒀐 NANŠE 𒀏 NINA 𒀏 AGARINX 𒀏 |UMUN2xGIN2| |UMUN2xHA| AĜARINX 𒀏 a-ga-ri2-num2 SIRARA 𒀏 SIRARA2 𒌓𒈣𒀏𒋓 SIRARA6 𒌓𒈣𒀏𒆠𒋳 𒀏 AB×ḪA 𒌓𒈣𒀏𒆠𒋳 UD MA2 AB×ḪA KI TAG 𒌓𒈣𒀏𒋓 UD MA2 AB×ḪA ŠIR
